Name:
Snowberry
Snowberry
Builder: George T. Davie & Sons Ltd., Lauzon
Out of service:
loaned to Royal Canadian Navy 15 May 1941
returned to Royal Navy 27 June 1945
Identification:
Pennant number: K166
Pennant number: K166
Fate: Returned from RCN June 1945. Scrapped in August 1947 at Middlesbrough.
Refit: Forecastle extended at Charleston on 14 May 1943.
awards: Atlantic 1941-44, Biscay 1943, English Channel 1945;[1] Gulf of St. Lawrence 1944[2]
Propulsion:
single shaft
2 × fire tube Scotch boilers
1 × 4-cycle triple-expansion reciprocating steam engine
2,750 ihp (2,050 kW)
Range: 3,500 nautical miles (6,482 km) at 12 knots (22.2 km/h)
processing systems:
1 × SW1C or 2C radar
1 × Type 123A or Type 127DV sonar
Armament:
1 × BL 4 in (102 mm) Mk.IX gun
2 × .50 cal machine gun (twin)
2 × Lewis .303 cal machine gun (twin)
2 × Mk.II depth charge throwers
2 × Depth charge rails with 40 depth charges
